bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 194 (Thursday, November 4, 2021)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. STEEL:H.R. 5885.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1 Section 8[Page H6208]

item.name: Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Subcommittee
Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation.
Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

summary.text:
This bill requires the Coast Guard to establish an interagency task force to address the vessel backlogs at the Port of Los Angeles and the Port of Long Beach and in the coastal waters of Orange County, California.

Specifically, the task force must

  • evaluate and quantify the impact of the vessel backlogs at the Port of Los Angeles and the Port of Long Beach,
  • evaluate and quantify the costs incurred by other federal, state, and local governments due to such vessel backlogs,
  • evaluate the responses of federal agencies to such vessel backlogs,
  • investigate the cause of the oil spill that occurred in October 2021 in the coastal waters of Orange County, and
  • develop and report on a plan to solve the vessel backlog and oil spill crises along the coast of southern California.

bill.title: To establish an interagency task force to address the backlog of cargo ships at the Port of Los Angeles and the Port of Long Beach and in the coastal waters of Orange County, California, and for other purposes.

item.title: To establish an interagency task force to address the backlog of cargo ships at the Port of Los Angeles and the Port of Long Beach and in the coastal waters of Orange County, California, and for other purposes.

To establish an interagency task force to address the backlog of cargo ships at the Port of Los Angeles and the Port of Long Beach and in the coastal waters of Orange County, California, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
